Berthe Marie Pauline Morisot

Home Biography Style and technique Impressionism

Chaumière en Normandie, 1865,

Oil on canvas, 46 × 55 cm. Private collection..

One of Morisot's first masterpieces, where her talent shines through in the way she strews the canvas with tree trunks to create views of a thatched cottage in the background.

In December 1873, Berthe Morisot, in the company of Claude Monet, Camille Pissarro, Auguste Renoir and Edgar Degas founded the Société Anonyme des Artistes Peintres, Sculpteurs et Graveurs (Manet refused to take part). The jury of the Salon of 1873 had been particularly severe – the painting Blanche by Morisot was however accepted – and this organization would allow its signatories to exhibit on the margins of official bodies.
